Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with part of single band in added white; exterior, slip partly worn: part of elaborate rosette; at right, part of undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: If the sherd comes from a Chalice Style chalice, the scene on the vase would have been an antithetical one with two confronted lions or sphinxes spearated by the rosette.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0903) (phase 2)
